items.description: Rivers Clyst and Culm and their tributaries
items.eaAreaName: Devon, Cornwall and the Isles of Scilly
items.message: Flooding is possible throughout today, Sunday 13th March. Heavy rain over the last 24 hours has caused river levels on the Clyst and Culm to remain high, and flooding to low lying land and roads is possible. Heavy showers will continue to develop on Sunday and Monday, and river levels remain sensitive to further rainfall. Take care near the areas of concern and monitor your local weather conditions. We are constantly monitoring river levels and will update this message on Monday 14th March, or earlier if the situation changes.

items.eaAreaName: Devon, Cornwall and the Isles of Scilly

floodArea.riverOrSea: River Teign, River Bovey, River Lemon, River Kenn

items.message: The risk of flooding in the River Teign Area has now reduced, and river levels are falling below levels of concern. Heavy showers will continue to develop throughout Devon on Sunday and Monday, and river levels will remain sensitive to any further rainfall. Take care near the areas of concern and monitor your local weather conditions.

items.description: Rivers Otter and Sid, and Exmouth area
items.eaAreaName: Devon, Cornwall and the Isles of Scilly
items.message: The risk of flooding in the Rivers Otter and Sid, and Exmouth Area has now reduced, and river levels are falling below levels of concern. Heavy showers will continue to develop throughout Devon on Sunday and Monday, and river levels will remain sensitive to any further rainfall. Take care near the areas of concern and monitor your local weather conditions.

River levels have risen at the Lugwardine river gauge as a result of rainfall over the weekend.  Consequently, flooding of roads and farmland is possible from Sunday evening 13/03/22.  We expect flooding to affect Low lying land and roads adjacent to the River Lugg south of Leominster from Stoke Prior to Mordiford. Other locations that may be affected include Bodenham, Lugwardine and Hampton Bishop.   
Further light rainfall is forecast over the next 24 hours.  We expect river levels to remain high until Monday 14/03/22.
We are closely monitoring the situation.  Our incident response staff are checking defences.  
Please avoid using low lying footpaths near local watercourses and plan driving routes to avoid low lying roads near rivers, which may be flooded.  
This message will be updated by 09:00 am on 14/03/22, or as the situation changes.
